5.heading: Browne, Chance, 1948-
5.title: "I Want to Compete"
5.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: He wants a match, she wants to volley, he wants competition, she wants to remain on speaking terms.
Key word: Tennis, tennis courts, he vs. she, she vs. he.

6.heading: Browne, Chance, 1948-

7.heading: Browne, Chance, 1948-
7.title: "The Temperature is Always Milder on the Other Side of the Season"
7.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: The twins wish for snow in the summer, and summer in the winter.
Key words: heat, weather.

8.heading: Browne, Chance, 1948-
8.title: "Tofu and Bean Sprouts Sandwiches"
8.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Irma makes Thirsty's lunch every day to help him lose weight, but he stops by Greasy Joe's deli.

9.heading: Browne, Chance, 1948-
9.title: "You Don't Play Real Music"
9.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Chip's not playing a song, he's playing a pentatonic scale.
Key words: Guitars, amplifiers, sunglasses, grandfathers.

161.title: Browne, Chance, 1948-
notes: American comics artist Bob (Robert) Browne, who signs his work "Chance Browne." More listings of his work appear in the entry for Hi and Lois, which Chance Browne began drawing in 1981 and took over from his father in 1989
